meanings.definition: To make free or set at liberty.
meanings.sent1: The kind teacher helped enfree the bird from its cage.
meanings.sent2: The activists worked together to enfree the animals from captivity.
meanings.sent3: The magician used a spell to enfree the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent4: The key to enfreeing oneself from fear is to face it head-on.
meanings.sent5: The hero's mission was to enfree the kingdom from the evil sorcerer's rule.

meanings.definition: To release from bondage or restraint.
meanings.sent1: The superhero used his powers to enfree the hostages from the villains.
meanings.sent2: The lockpick was the tool needed to enfree the prisoner from the cell.
meanings.sent3: The genie granted the wish to enfree the person from their chains.
meanings.sent4: The truth will enfree you from the lies that bind you.
meanings.sent5: The key to enfreeing the mind is to let go of negative thoughts.

meanings.sent1: The brave soldiers fought to enfree the oppressed people from tyranny.
meanings.sent2: Education has the power to enfree individuals from ignorance.
meanings.sent3: The fairy used her magic wand to enfree the characters from the storybook.
meanings.sent4: Music has the ability to enfree the soul from worldly worries.
meanings.sent5: The journey of self-discovery can enfree you from self-doubt and limitations.
